Caption: Fig. 1. Examples of extensions and modifications of parallel coordinates that have been evaluated. All images are reproduced with the permission of their respective copyright holder.

Table 1. The 23 identified papers on evaluating parallel coordinates (PC) divided into the four constructed categories. Most evaluations have been performed within categories 1-Evaluating axis layouts of PC and 4-Comparing PC with other analysis techniques. The study presented in [47] is classified into both category 3 and 4.

Table 2. This table illustrates how 26 identified techniques perform in relation to standard 2D parallel coordinates (2DPC) for 7 tasks. A yellow colour indicates no significant difference in performance. A green colour means that the technique outperforms 2DPC for the specific task. A red colour means that the technique performs worse than 2DPC. A light blue colour shows that no evaluation has been found in the literature. ∇ denotes that the technique is based on animation.
